intro: Lepidotis magellanica, commonly known as the Magellanic burr, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. The fruit is a dry, spiny capsule that aids in wind dispersal of its seeds.
